Event Organizer: Michael Blair @ 978-808-1932

=====

Read the entire description before you RSVP and answer all questions that are part of the RSVP. Failure to answer them will result in your removal from this event. If you RSVP from a mobile device the questions may not show up - use a computer to update your RSVP so you can answer them.

Your safety, and the safety of the group, is the most important thing. If you underestimate the demands of this event; overestimate your experience, knowledge, skills or abilities; or come unprepared you put yourself and others at risk – consider this before you decide to participate.

=====

NOTE 06/01: The date of this event was changed to 06/11 because Redbones changed the date of their event (weather forecast). Unfortunately, I am NOT able to participate on this new date because I will be helping the AMC with a class in NH. I am going to keep the event listed though in case randomites want to unite and participate on their own.

=====

What we're doing

During a ride along the Minuteman Bike Path last year we got to talking about local places to get some good food after the ride, and while we didn't go there that night the idea of getting some ribs at Redbones in Somerville, MA entered the conversation.

Not sure whose idea it was but I can say that it sounded like a great one. So a new random tradition was born that night - The Random Rib Ride.

This year's (first) ride will be on June 4, 2012 because Redbones will be having one of their huge cookouts - they close down the street and put up a tent. This will be their 16th Annual Bike Party & Benefit - proceeds will go to NEMBA & MassBike.

The cost is $15 - this gets you food & drink, bicycle valet parking, and a raffle ticket. Additional raffle tickets are $2.00 each or three for $5.00 - the grand prize is a new bike.

There will also be live music by several local groups.

Exercise. Food. Friends. Live Music. Support some good causes. Not a bad night.

Redbones is about 1.5 miles from Alewife and while I will have a car parked at Alewife I will likely ride my bike to and from Redbones. If you would rather walk or take the T (Redline from Alewife to Davis Square) that is up to you.

If you would like to meet us only for the ribs then just meet us there - don't even bother signing up here on the site. We plan to arrive at about 7:00.

=====

Trip Summary

The objective is to ride at about a 12 - 15 MPH pace.

We will start at Alewife Station in Cambridge and ride out towards Bedford, MA before turning around and heading back. We will turn around so that we get to Redbones at about 7:00 since the raffle is at 7:30.

While I have been on this trail many times before I did all of my current research for this trip using the Internet. You should become familiar with this information since you are ultimately responsible for your own safety.

The Minuteman Bikeway is a former railroad right of way that travels about 11 miles through the historic area where the American Revolution began in April 1775 - Bedford, Lexington, Arlington, and Cambridge. It offers a 12-foot wide paved surface for the entire length and offers several resting stops along the way.

Click here for information about the Minuteman Bikeway

=====

Weather

Dangerous weather conditions will cancel - I will post an update and/or send an email to all confirmed participants a day or two before this event.

We will assess travel and weather conditions during the ride and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

Click here for the current weather forecast for this trip

=====

Clothing and Equipment

Below is a list describing the minimum required clothing and equipment to participate in this event. DO NOT rely on others to share with you once we begin. You should know how to use all of your equipment - test and adjust it prior to this trip.

  • Helmet: You must wear a properly sized and adjusted bicycle helmet that has been tested and meets the uniform safety standard issued by the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC).
  • Food and Water: High-energy snacks and enough water to stay properly hydrated during the trip.
  • Other Essential Gear: White headlight and red taillight. A multi-purpose tool or small repair kit. A spare tube.

=====

Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the bike safety tips at Same Roads, Same Rules; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
